entry.title: Sidetalk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the phrase "bing bong" became a rallying cry for the New York Knicks because of its appearance on Sidetalk (logo pictured)?

entry.title: Sarkis Lole (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sarkis Lole, the Armenian chief architect of Mardin who constructed much of the early modern architecture of the city, never received any formal training and designed his buildings in the sand?

entry.title: Cort Theatre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Cort Theatre has hosted the Broadway debuts of actresses Katharine Hepburn and Grace Kelly?

entry.title: Mimi Fawaz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mimi Fawaz's work includes a documentary on the life of South African president Nelson Mandela?

entry.title: I Bet You Think About Me (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the music video to "I Bet You Think About Me" by Taylor Swift is co-written and directed by Blake Lively in her directorial debut?

entry.title: cassette tapes for storage (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when home computers used cassette tapes for storage, the data was sometimes distributed on flexi disc records or even broadcast on radio?

entry.title: microbiomes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that non-microscopic life forms such as plants associate with microbiomes of microscopic organisms which determine their health and productivity?

entry.title: Empire Tract (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Herbert Hoover once farmed sugar beets on the Empire Tract?
